Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative Cognitive Training in Older Cardiac Surgery Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to either perioperative CT via a mobile device or usual care.

Participants.evidence: This single-center randomised controlled trial included 45 adults aged 60–90 undergoing cardiac surgery at least 10 days post-enrollment.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to either perioperative CT via a mobile device or usual care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the feasibility and potential efficacy of a perioperative cognitive training (CT) program to reduce these conditions.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was feasibility, assessed by enrollment and adherence.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This single-center randomised controlled trial included 45 adults aged 60–90 undergoing cardiac surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of delirium was 25% in the CT group versus 15% in controls (P = .69), and POCD was 53% versus 37% (P = .33).
